Patch Set 26:

(1 comment)
Lots to do here.  I haven't reviewed the full patch yet.
?  I don't think tolerance or accuracy have anything to do with this conversion?
Done
Where is this function used? I do not see a usage in this PR.
Should it be const type ..?

This function is used in the below patch.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/38905

I will change this and submit a new patchset.
Done

You throw here, but then don't catch it anywhere, which has the potential to crash dbus-sensors.  Generally for these kinds of conversions we rely on returning NAN to the error algorithms can know that the value didn't parse.
Done
nit: unnecessary copy?
Done
This is a static global that's indexed on bus address.  This code will fail if there are two IPMB devices on the same bus.  Please abstract to non-static member variables.
Ack

This is a linear scan of the SDR for EVERY sensor reading at potentially hundreds per second.  This is not going to meet performance targets.

I suspect this class needs broken down better such that we have a separate class that can simply store the appropriate M and B values in the sensor readings class, instead of looking them up at global scope.
Done
nit, extra parens.
Done
This code looks copied from where we do the thresholding behavior.  Can this be deduplicated into a method please?
Done
nit : meaningful name ..?
Done
This is way too much logic to be doing in a lambda.  Please break it out into normal functions (in a separate patch) then add to them as needed.
Done
nit : You can use meaningful name instead generic one.
Done
There's no mention of this in your commit message, nor is it immediately obvious to me why it's needed.  Maybe it needs its own patch and commit message?
Ack
I see three review with topic IPMB-based-SDR, are there dependency among the three? Should they be reviewed in certain order?

Yes, there are dependency for each patch. 
This implementation is about reading SDR based on IPMB and displaying dbus path under xyz.openbmc_project.IpmbSensor.
To make the review easier, I submitted this feature in multiple patches. 

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/52160
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/53645
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/38905
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/52164
Ack
Make this a function of IpmbSDRDevice?
Ack
Keep busIndex commandAddress and sensorNum command translation in one place, ie in IpmbSensor. IpmbSDRdevice only know about busIndex and sensorNum
Done
check busIndex and sensorNum are valid?
Done
What if it is other sdr type?
This patch currently supports SDR Type 1 and this type only supports threshold based sensor. Therefore, other SDR type doesn't need this.
should there be else { return error;}
It does not need else part, since, only few sensor will handle negative reading. Other sensors can return the dataVal.

If key doesn't exist in map then operator[] just constructs one value object and put at given index. In other words even if `sensorValRecord[busIndex][sensorNum]` doesn't exist this code will will create new key, value and move on without any warning. Is it acceptable for your code flow ? If no please consider using at() in place of operator[]. It will throw if index doesn't exist.
Sample code
https://godbolt.org/z/fWh5Ee1c8
Done
LGTM
sdrtype01 is assumed in different places, this would make adding support for another type harder. Can this be encapsulated into one place?

As per my understanding from IPMI spec, this only supports type 1 SDR. Other SDR types may not be support this maxPosReadingMargin.

Variables which are supported only for SDR type 1 will comes under sdrtype01 namespace.

This check should not be done for other SDR types that do not support maxPosReadingMargin?

My point is also that sdrtype01 is assumed in multiple places. Extending this to accept other sdr type is hard and can be error prone.

> This check should not be done for other SDR types that do not support maxPosReadingMargin?
> 

yes


> My point is also that sdrtype01 is assumed in multiple places. Extending this to accept other sdr type is hard and can be error prone.

Currently, sdr type 1 is supported, therefore, it is named as sdrtype01. Also, function which supports sdr type 1 only has sdrtype01 namespace. If the common code shares for other sdr types, it will be changed in other sdr types patches, which will be submitted after getting sdr type 1 patches approved.
IpmbSDRDevice and dataConversion() are not just for sdrtype01. they are not in sdrType01 namespace.

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/52164/16/src/IpmbSensor.cpp#409

IpmbType will differ for other SDR types, therefore, only SDR type 1 will call dataConversion function.
why +1?
In previous patch, ipmbBusIndex value is incremented and stored in structure at the start, therefore, it is incremented here. Now changed in both places and removed +1.
A couple of changes requested based on IPMI spec compliance and an error message.
The only sensor number reserved in IPMI is sensor number 0xFF.  Thus, sensorNum of zero is a valid sensor number.
Done

There are multiple conditions which may lead to an invalid sensor record including the sensor is no longer operational, device removed from the system, etc.  Thus, the error message is misleading and possibly incorrect.
Done
why not just int?
It was a comment given before to add const.
Wait for https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/53645
